reviews.text: Pretty small town with lots of characters

This small station is on the Heart of Wessex Railway line between Bristol Temple Meads and Weymouth

Primarily served by Great Western railway with 7 or 8 trains a day on Mondays to Fridays and Saturdays and a more limited service on a Sunday - some limited additional trains are serviced by South western Railway on Mondays to Fridays and goes via Yeovil Pen Mill to/from Westbury and to/from London Waterloo

There is no disabled access  on the south side to Weymouth and you would need to make alternative arrangement's - no lift and the exit is by steps

Information is available on a screen and a help point

No ticket office or ticket machine but either buy your ticket in advance (no deals for doing this other than convenience) or from the guard on duty

Platform one for trains to Westbury, Bath and Bristol Temple Meads

Platform 2 for trains to Castel Cary, Yeovil Pen Mill and stations to Weymouth

The above is clearly marked and there is also a note of what there is to do in Bruton
